bibl.title: Letter from I.T. Haig to Philip Showalter Hench, September 30, 1940

div1.p: Haig has forwarded Hench's letter regarding framboyant trees to Arthur Bevan.

div1.head: Letter from I.T. Haig to Philip Showalter Hench, September 30, 1940
div1.opener:
YOURS IN TRUST
WE MUST PROTECT IT
FROM FIRE
UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE
FOREST SERVICE
FOREST SERVICE
DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE
U S
WASHINGTON
September 30, 1940.
FORMATION
quiries
Dr. P. S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p: Reference is made to your letter of September 21.

We have forwarded your letter of August 28 to Mr. Bevan
and I believe you will hear from him shortly relative to the
flamboyant trees. However, in case you are anxious to write
before you hear from him, his address is: Mr. Arthur Bevan,
Director, Tropical Forest Experiment Station, Rio Piedras, Puerto
Rico.

closer.signed:
I. T. HAIG, Chief,
Division of Forest Management Research.
